events.originalText: A fire severely damaged Grenfell Tower in North Kensington, London, killing 72 people.
events.subtitle: Grenfell Tower fire
events.headline: Fire at Grenfell Tower in London Kills 72

events.originalText: War in Donbas: An Ilyushin Il-76 transport aircraft of the Ukrainian Air Force was shot down by forces of the self-proclaimed Luhansk People's Republic, killing all 49 people on board.
events.subtitle: War in Donbas
events.headline: Ukrainian Air Force Plane Shot Down in Donbas, Killing 49

events.originalText: Falklands War: British prime minister Margaret Thatcher announced that white flags were flying over Port Stanley, in advance of the formal surrender of Argentine forces.
events.subtitle: Falklands War
events.headline: Margaret Thatcher Announces Surrender of Argentine Forces in Falklands War

events.originalText: Emerson, Lake & Palmer released the progressive rock album Tarkus.
events.subtitle: Emerson, Lake & Palmer
events.headline: Emerson, Lake & Palmer Release Album Tarkus

events.originalText: The Vatican formally abolished its 427-year-old list of prohibited books.
events.subtitle: Holy See
events.headline: Vatican Abolishes List of Prohibited Books

events.originalText: Albert II became the first monkey in space, reaching an altitude of 134 km (83 mi) in a V-2 rocket.
events.subtitle: Albert II (monkey)
events.headline: Albert II Becomes First Monkey in Space

events.originalText: Second World War: The British Army abandoned its attempt to capture the German-occupied city of Caen.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: British Army Abandons Attempt to Capture Caen in WWII

events.originalText: Second World War: Four days after the French government fled Paris, German forces occupied the French capital, a major accomplishment in the Fall Rot operation.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: German Forces Occupy Paris in WWII

events.originalText: The Soviet Union issued an ultimatum to Lithuania demanding that the Red Army be allowed to enter the country and form a pro-Soviet government.
events.subtitle: Soviet ultimatum to Lithuania
events.headline: Soviet Union Issues Ultimatum to Lithuania

events.originalText: The second of the German Naval Laws was passed, authorising the  doubling in size of the Imperial German Navy.
events.subtitle: German Naval Laws
events.headline: German Naval Laws Passed to Double Navy Size

events.originalText: Settlers in Sonoma began rebelling against Mexico, later proclaiming the California Republic and  raising a homemade flag with a bear and a star.
events.subtitle: Sonoma, California
events.headline: Settlers in Sonoma Rebel Against Mexico

events.originalText: In a paper presented to the Royal Astronomical Society, English mathematician Charles Babbage proposed a difference engine (pictured), an automatic, mechanical calculator designed to tabulate polynomial functions.
events.subtitle: Royal Astronomical Society
events.headline: Charles Babbage Proposes Difference Engine

events.originalText: War of the Second Coalition: In the Battle of Marengo, Napoleonic forces secured victory over the Habsburgs when defeat had appeared inevitable until the arrival of French troops led by Louis Desaix.
events.subtitle: War of the Second Coalition
events.headline: Napoleonic Forces Secure Victory in Battle of Marengo

events.originalText: The Second Continental Congress adopted the stars and stripes design for the flag of the United States.
events.subtitle: Second Continental Congress
events.headline: Stars and Stripes Design Adopted for US Flag

events.originalText: Franco-Spanish War: French and Spanish fleets fought the inconclusive Battle of Orbetello, with sailing vessels of both sides having to be towed into action by galleys due to light winds.
events.subtitle: Franco-Spanish War (1635–1659)
events.headline: French and Spanish Fleets Fight Battle of Orbetello

events.originalText: First English Civil War: Prince Maurice] abandoned his siege of Lyme Regis in Dorset after learning of the approach of a Parliamentarian relief force.
events.subtitle: First English Civil War
events.headline: Prince Maurice Abandons Siege of Lyme Regis

events.originalText: During the Peasants' Revolt in England, rebels stormed the Tower of London, killing Simon Sudbury, Lord Chancellor, and Robert Hales, Lord High Treasurer (both pictured).
events.subtitle: Peasants' Revolt
events.headline: Peasants' Revolt Rebels Storm Tower of London
